==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=uc|rs=皮10}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[しゅ]] (shu)
|kanon=[[すう]] (sū)
|kanyoon=[[しゅう]] (shū)
|kun=[[さび]] (sabi), [[しぼ]] (shibo), [[しわ]] (shiwa)
}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|皺曲|しゅうきょく}}
* {{ja-r|皺襞|しゅうへき}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|さび|yomi=k}}
Origins unclear. Possibly related to {{m|ja|錆|tr=sabi||rust, oxidation}}, from the way the surface of something changes.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|さび}}

# a [[pattern]] of [[crack]]s and [[wrinkle]]s on the [[surface]] of an {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black hat}} formed as the black [[lacquer]] dries

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|大皺|おおさび}}
* {{ja-r|小皺|こさび}}
* {{ja-r|皺烏帽子|さび えぼし}}
* {{ja-r|柳皺|やなぎさび}}
* {{ja-r|横皺|よこさび}}
* {{ja-r|横皺の烏帽子|よこさび の えぼし}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|しぼ|yomi=k}}
Probably from stem ''shiwo'' of classical verb ''shiworu'', modern ''shioru'' ({{l|ja|萎る}}, {{l|ja|撓る}}: “to make something loosen, to make something wither and wrinkle”). Probably cognate with ''shiwa'' below.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|しぼ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しぼ}}

# a [[pattern]] of [[crack]]s and [[wrinkle]]s on the [[surface]] of an {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black hat}} formed as the black [[lacquer]] dries
# a pattern of [[pucker]]s and [[bulge]]s in a cloth, caused by the [[warp]] and [[woof]] of the material
# a similar pattern of puckers and bulges formed on the surface of [[paper]] or [[leather]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|皺紙|しぼがみ}}
* {{ja-r|皺丸太|しぼまるた}}
* {{ja-r|竹皺|たけしぼ}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|しわ|yomi=k}}
Probably from stem ''shiwa'' of verb ''shiwaru'' ({{l|ja|撓る}}: “to sag, as something elastic that has lost its bounce”). Probably cognate with ''shibo'' above.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|しわ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|皴}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しわ}}

# [[wrinkle]]s in [[skin]], [[paper]], [[cloth]], or some other surface
# [[ripple]]s on the [[surface]] of [[water]]
# a [[pattern]] of [[crack]]s and [[wrinkle]]s on the [[surface]] of an {{m|ja|烏帽子|tr=eboshi||traditional Japanese formal black hat}} formed as the black [[lacquer]] dries

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|雄陽皺|おひじわ}}
* {{ja-r|小皺|こじわ}}
* {{ja-r|皺紙|しわがみ}}
* {{ja-r|皺くちゃ|しわくちゃ}}
* {{ja-r|皺皺|しわしわ}}
* {{ja-r|皺伸ばし|しわのばし}}
* {{ja-r|皺腹|しわばら}}
* {{ja-r|皺ぶ|しわぶ}}
* {{ja-r|皺む|しわむ}}
* {{ja-r|皺める|しわめる}}
* {{ja-r|皺寄せ|しわよせ}}
* {{ja-r|畳み皺|たたみじわ}}
* {{ja-r|縦皺|たてじわ}}
* {{ja-r|縮緬皺|ちりめんじわ}}
* {{ja-r|防皺|ぼうしわ}}
* {{ja-r|防皺加工|ぼうしわ かこう}}

{{der-bottom}}

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|皺伸ぶ|しわ のぶ}}, {{ja-r|皺が伸びる|しわ が のびる}}: “one's wrinkles slacken” → to become [[light-hearted]] in [[old age]]
* {{ja-r|皺を伸ばす|しわ を のばす}}: “to slacken one's wrinkles” → to [[relax]], to [[take a breather]], to [[let it all hang out]]; to smooth out wrinkles, such as by [[ironing]]
{{der-bottom}}
